member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Refactorings.Infra.IRefactoringDefinition.AcquireContext(JetBrains.ActionManagement.IDataContext,JetBrains.DataFlow.IPropertyBag)

summary.para: Acquires the environmental information from the data context and transfers to the bag.

As the refactoring is running, its only source of information is the bag. It's easy to populate the bag when running the refactoring programmatically. When run from UI, this information has to be collected from the action's data context.

Don't copy excessive information from the data context, as this will make it harder for plugin writers to learn what your refactoring wants. To obtain that information, they should inspect the bag after calling this method.

member.param: The action's data context, to take the useful environmental information from.
The property bag on which the refactoring will run.

member.name: P:JetBrains.ReSharper.Refactorings.Infra.RefactoringWorkflowChart.DivergingTracks
member.summary: Gets the list of diverging tracks between the states. A track described by a goes from TKey and into the TValue, which are the names of states. and together comprise the full set of tracks between the states. Each state can have any number of incoming tracks. The final state () has no outgoing tracks. The “switch” state () has two emerging tracks, one of which is straight, and the other is diverging; whether to go straight or diverge is defined by the criterion on the track. All the other states have exactly one outgoing track, which is straight.
